result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean M Stella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Total costs to be paid while on probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant must apply for sexual registration.
Defendant to submit DNA sample while in custody.
Pay supervision fees.

timeConds.notes: Work release authorized for treatment and work

Defendant Sean M Stella in court with attorney Craig S Powell for Atty Hart.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant and/or counsel requests matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Conditions set by court: no contact with anyone under 17 yrs of age, no access to items capable of internet access such as computers, phones, etc.

Defendant Sean M Stella in court with attorney Wilfred P de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Adam Y Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time, may retain private counsel.  Waive reading of felony complaint. State requests $10,000 cash bail with conditions of no contact minors under 17 yrs old and no access with computers or internet.   Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
